definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to grip forcefully/to clutch at/to guard/to control/to hold
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: The news reports of journalists of radio and TV station need to be concise.
sentences.chinese: 電臺和電視臺的記者的新聞報道必須簡明扼要。

sentences.english: Keep all things short and to the point.
This problem was capsulized in his letter.
sentences.chinese: 在他的信中簡明扼要地提到這個問題。

sentences.english: In general, the presentation must be to-the-point and concise.
sentences.chinese: 一般而言，表達應當簡明扼要。

sentences.english: Just as it's a good thing to keep program definitions short and to the point, tables should be short.
sentences.chinese: 與保持程序定義簡明扼要相同，表也應該保持簡短。

sentences.english: As threats go, It was concise and to the point.
sentences.chinese: 這是封恐嚇信，信的內容簡明扼要。

sentences.english: This book provides a clear and concise introduction to the philosophy of Gilles Deleuze.
sentences.chinese: 這本書提供了一個向德勒茲哲學作了簡明扼要的介紹。

sentences.english: Please say it clearly and simply.
sentences.chinese: 請簡明扼要地說清你的意思。

sentences.english: The explanation in this dictionary is concise and to the point.
sentences.chinese: 這部詞典裏的釋義簡明扼要。

sentences.english: In this concise, crisply readable book, Professor D.
sentences.chinese: 在這本簡明扼要，清晰易讀的書裏，D。
